intro: Calatola, commonly known as the "buttercup of the mountains," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Violaceae. These plants are native to various regions in the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe, Asia, and North America. Calatola species are typically herbaceous perennials with showy, yellow or orange flowers that resemble those of the buttercup. They often grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to their distinctive appearance.
